html: Yes, the WH is spinning the Mueller report. Yes, Barr is acting like Trump’s personal lawyer. Yes, it’s disgraceful. But we also must stay focused on the larger threat: Russia is going to keep trying to influence our elections, Trump or no Trump. And we need a plan to stop it.
text:
Yes, the WH is spinning the Mueller report. Yes, Barr is acting like Trump’s personal lawyer. Yes, it’s disgraceful.

But we also must stay focused on the larger threat: Russia is going to keep trying to influence our elections, Trump or no Trump. And we need a plan to stop it.

html: Even before we have had a chance to see the Mueller report, AG Barr made it clear that the Russians interfered in the 2016 election, a fact that President Trump continues to deny. Where is the White House commitment and plan to stop that in 2020?
text: Even before we have had a chance to see the Mueller report, AG Barr made it clear that the Russians interfered in the 2016 election, a fact that President Trump continues to deny. Where is the White House commitment and plan to stop that in 2020?

html: President Trump’s decision to slash refugee admissions has been a drastic departure from our longstanding commitment to vulnerable people around the world. The GRACE Act will help reestablish our moral authority & ensure that we don't forsake those most in need of our assistance.
text: President Trump’s decision to slash refugee admissions has been a drastic departure from our longstanding commitment to vulnerable people around the world. The GRACE Act will help reestablish our moral authority & ensure that we don't forsake those most in need of our assistance.

html: America was founded by refugees. We should not close our borders, our shores, or our hearts to them. Today, @RepZoeLofgren, @RepJoeNeguse and I are introducing the GRACE Act to prevent a U.S. President from setting refugee admissions a level below 95,000 in a given year.pic.twitter.com/StfT7mL7Th
text: America was founded by refugees. We should not close our borders, our shores, or our hearts to them. Today, @RepZoeLofgren, @RepJoeNeguse and I are introducing the GRACE Act to prevent a U.S. President from setting refugee admissions a level below 95,000 in a given year.pic.twitter.com/StfT7mL7Th

html: Today, I joined @RepZoeLofgren & @SenMarkey to introduce the GRACE Act, legislation that will prevent a U.S. President from slashing refugee admission numbers, as President Trump has done. We must uphold our commitment to the most vulnerable people around the world.

html: Gay marriage. Family separation. The Muslim ban. DACA. Federal district court judges make the first decisions in the country’s most important cases. And @SenateGOP just limited debate on the confirmation of district court nominees to only 2 hours. This will hurt us for decades.
text:
Gay marriage. Family separation. The Muslim ban. DACA.
 
Federal district court judges make the first decisions in the country’s most important cases. And @SenateGOP just limited debate on the confirmation of district court nominees to only 2 hours. This will hurt us for decades.

html: The sun is setting on the dirty energy of the past. The #GreenNewDeal calls for an historic 10-year mobilization. We have the technology to do it. We have the moral obligation. We have the economic imperative. We just need the political will. (5/5)
text:
The sun is setting on the dirty energy of the past. The #GreenNewDeal calls for an historic 10-year mobilization.

We have the technology to do it. We have the moral obligation. We have the economic imperative. We just need the political will. (5/5)

html: In 2008, there were only 2,580 electric vehicles on the road in the United States. Ten years later, there are more than 1 million. (4/5)
text:
In 2008, there were only 2,580 electric vehicles on the road in the United States. 

Ten years later, there are more than 1 million. (4/5)

html: In 2008, there were around 80,000 solar jobs. In 2018, there were 242,343 solar jobs. We created almost as many solar jobs in the U.S. in 2016 alone as exist in the entire coal mining industry today. (3/5)
text:
In 2008, there were around 80,000 solar jobs.

In 2018, there were 242,343 solar jobs. 

We created almost as many solar jobs in the U.S. in 2016 alone as exist in the entire coal mining industry today. (3/5)

html: In 2008, we had only 25,065 megawatts of total wind capacity installed. In 2018, we had 98,000 megawatts of wind capacity installed. (2/5)
text:
In 2008, we had only 25,065 megawatts of total wind capacity installed. 

In 2018, we had 98,000 megawatts of wind capacity installed. (2/5)

html: We have already laid the foundation for our climate future that the #GreenNewDeal will build on: In 2008, we had only 1,237 megawatts of total solar capacity installed. In 2018, we had 65,000 megawatts of solar capacity installed. (1/5)
text:
We have already laid the foundation for our climate future that the #GreenNewDeal will build on:

In 2008, we had only 1,237 megawatts of total solar capacity installed. 

In 2018, we had 65,000 megawatts of solar capacity installed. (1/5)

html: We need massive renewable energy deployment. Wind, solar, offshore wind, storage batteries. Our energy future will not be found in the dark of a mine, but in the light of the sun. We have acted on this scale before, and we must do it again. #GreenNewDeal

We need massive renewable energy deployment. Wind, solar, offshore wind, storage batteries. Our energy future will not be found in the dark of a mine, but in the light of the sun. 

We have acted on this scale before, and we must do it again. #GreenNewDeal

html: Global temperatures are the highest in recorded history. Wealth inequality is at its highest point since the era of the Great Depression. The interrelationship of these ills and injustices is undeniable. But the challenge is not insurmountable. We can deliver a #GreenNewDeal.
text:
Global temperatures are the highest in recorded history.

Wealth inequality is at its highest point since the era of the Great Depression.

The interrelationship of these ills and injustices is undeniable. But the challenge is not insurmountable.

We can deliver a #GreenNewDeal.

html: My climate action priorities for the new Congress: -Move the U.S. to 100% clean energy within the next 2 decades -Unleash energy efficiency across the country -Stop the fossil fuel exports that are fueling our global addiction -Lay down the markers for putting a price on carbon
text:
My climate action priorities for the new Congress:

-Move the U.S. to 100% clean energy within the next 2 decades
-Unleash energy efficiency across the country
-Stop the fossil fuel exports that are fueling our global addiction
-Lay down the markers for putting a price on carbon
